news_header: Boeing lost nearly $1 billion a month in 2024 due to a safety crisis, quality control issues, and a damaging strike, resulting in an annual loss of $11.8 billion.
news_text: In 2024, Boeing faced significant challenges, losing $11.8 billion, its worst result since 2020. The company struggled with safety and quality control issues, highlighted by a serious incident involving a 737 Max. A strike by 33,000 workers halted production and cost billions. New CEO Kelly Ortberg aims to implement fundamental changes to restore trust and stabilize operations, while the defense unit also suffered losses due to rising costs.
